Trump warns Hamas and Iran after Netanyahu talks in Mar-a-Lago
subhed: Speaking at a news conference with the Israeli prime minister in Florida, Trump threatened to 'eradicate' any attempt by Tehran to rebuild its nuclear program or ballistic missile arsenal following US and Israeli strikes earlier this year. He also said Hamas would have 'hell to pay' if it fails to disarm in Gaza.

subhed: The son of the former French president is running a headline-grabbing campaign in Mention, both on the ground and across social media, as he tries to make a name for himself in a city where the far right enjoys strong support.

title: The 2026 FIFA World Cup is shaping up to be 'America First' and, above all, 'Business First'
subhed: The World Cup, which will be held in the United States, Canada and Mexico from June 11 to June 27, 2026, will be neither politically neutral, nor financially accessible, nor inclusive. It stands in stark contrast to the principles of grassroots football, writes Stéphane Lauer, columnist for Le Monde, in his opinion piece.

title: Beyoncé now a billionaire, Forbes says
subhed: The 44-year-old entertainer joins a select club that includes her husband, rapper Jay-Z, as well as Taylor Swift, Bruce Springsteen and Rihanna, according to the publication, known for its rankings of the world's richest people.

title: Immigrants in Chile fear for their future after a far-right leader won the presidential election
byline: By Angeline Montoya (Antofagasta, Chile, special correspondent)
subhed: José Antonio Kast, president-elect since December 14, focused his campaign on the fight against undocumented immigration. Many have urged outgoing President Gabriel Boric to regularize undocumented migrants before his term ends.

Trump, the Apocalypse and King David: A theological reading of the US president
subhed: Since his first term, the American president has frequently made apocalyptic and messianic references. Some supporters compare him to biblical figures such as King David, appealing particularly to evangelical Christians, who make up about one-fifth of Americans.

title: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhed: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.

title: Brigitte Bardot, global film icon and champion of animal rights, has died
subhed: The actress who triggered a revolution with her performance in 'And God Created Woman' passed away on December 28 at the age of 91. She appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and devoting her life to animal rights.
